KnowledgeBase.Title: Example String compareNE 001
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: compare compareEQ compareGT compareGE compareLT compareLE

Example.Description: These examples use the compareNE function to compare two Strings and return the Boolean value, true or false. In these examples, lowercase characters are compared as against uppercase characters.In the ASCII table, uppercase characters are represented by 65 to 90 while lowercase characters are repsented by 97 to 122. Using this table, lowercase characters have greater value than uppercase characters.

Syntax.Note: In this example, lowercase "h" in the first string has a higher value in the ASCII table than uppercase "H", therefore the strings are not equal.
